SEARCH
Package org.example.scenes

Class GameOverScene

java.lang.Object
org.example.scenes.Scene
org.example.scenes.GameOverScene
public class GameOverScene extends Scene
This class is used to implement the screen after the game over. It consists with one question and to answers. You can start the game again if you click the yes button or go to main menu if you click on no button
Since:
1.0
Version:
1.0
Author:
Ne-MoBu-u-Ne-ToNu

    • GameOverScene

      keyListener - class for register keyboard buttons
      mouseListener - class for register mouse and cursor

  • Method Details

    • update

      public void update(double dt)
      Method to update current state. It is used to navigate between game screens. After 'death' in the game you will have to choose if you want to start again or no. If yes you redirect to the gaming screen. If no you redirect to the menu screen
      Specified by:
      update in class Scene
      Parameters:
      dt - difference of time between updates

    • draw

      public void draw(Graphics g)
      Method to draw current screen with its current state
      Specified by:
      draw in class Scene
      Parameters:
      g - graphics object to draw on the screen
